name: PyUSB
body:
# PyUSB - Easy USB access on Python

PyUSB aims to be an easy to use Python module to access USB devices.
PyUSB relies on a native system library for USB access. Currently, it works
out of the box with [libusb 0.1](http://libusb.sourceforge.net/doc/),
[libusb 1.0](http://www.libusb.org/), [libusbx](http://libusbx.org/),
[libusb-win32](http://www.libusb.org/wiki/libusb-win32)
and [OpenUSB](https://sourceforge.net/projects/openusb/),
and works with any PyUSB version starting at 2.4, including Python 3 releases.

### Documentation

The best way to start with PyUSB is through the
[PyUSB 1.0 tutorial](https://github.com/walac/pyusb/blob/master/docs/tutorial.rst),
and API reference can be found in the doc strings.

### Support

If you need support, you can subscribe to the
[mailing list](https://lists.sourceforge.net/lists/listinfo/pyusb-users). At the
SourceForge page you can find instructions on how to subscribe.

### Development

PyUSB development happens at [github](https://github.com/walac/pyusb), and tar
ball releases are made available at
[SourceForge](https://sourceforge.net/projects/pyusb/files/)
